paragraphs.text: Islamic civilisation is in Europe's DNA.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The brutal and tragic murders of 12 people at the offices of Charlie Hebdo in Paris - 10 staff members and two police officers - by masked gunmen has triggered an outpouring of shock and grief, not only in France but around the world
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Large, spontaneous vigils filled the streets of many French cities
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: while social media was awash with solidarity and condemnation, including the hashtags #JeSuisCharlie and #NotInMyName, which was used by Muslims condemning the attacks
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Police in France have identified and released the photographs of two brothers suspected to be involved in the attack
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: while early speculation focused on the premise that Muslim extremists were behind the dreadful act, especially given the magazine's long history of satirising Islam and other religions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The two brothers have been identified as 32-year-old Said Kouachi and 34-year-old Cherif Kouachi
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This theory has been reinforced by eyewitness accounts of the men shouting "Allahu Akbar"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Why Prophet Muhammad would need anyone to "avenge" him is beyond me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The prophet endured far more mockery, humiliation, insult and rejection during his lifetime without needing or ordering hitmen to defend his honour than that meted out by a group of equal-opportunity French cartoonists who despise and satirise all forms of organised religion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: like with Anders Breivik in Norway, the perpetrators turn out not to be linked to Islamist groups
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , the collateral damage to French and European Muslims has already been done, despite one of the fallen police officers being a Muslim
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With the strength of the Front National in France, UKIP in Britain and other anti-Muslim and anti-immigrant currents across Europe, a popular or populist backlash is almost inevitable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In neighbouring Germany, the thousands of Patriotic Europeans Against the Islamisation of the West (PEGIDA) who have turned out to rallies, though still small enough to be labelled a "flop", has set alarm bells ringing to the extent that strong counter protests have taken place
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Like Muslims who fantasise about an ahistorical caliphate, conservative Europeans who dream of a bygone utopia of a Europe uncontaminated by Islam or immigration, miss the reality that the "Islamisation of the West" occurred centuries ago
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Islamic civilisation is so hard-wired into Europe's cultural, social and intellectual DNA that it would be impossible to expunge its influence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The same applies in the other direction, in light of Christendom's and the West's powerful influence on Arab and Islamic society
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In addition to the philosophy, science, literature and art of the Muslim world which profoundly shaped the European Renaissance, Islamic culture had some far more unexpected and surprising influences on western civilisation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One man in particular, for whom no statues or memorials stand anywhere in Europe and very few westerners have heard of, is possibly the most unsung cultural, style and musical icon in European history
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the ninth century, Ziryab, Cordoba's most sought-after hipster, brought into vogue the idea of seasonal fashions, steering history's catwalk towards the fashion slavery of the 21st century
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This Sultan of Style also added a fifth pair of strings to the Arab "oud", paving the way to the European lute
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which would become the modern guitar
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He also introduced Europe to the idea of dining etiquette, from table cloths and crystal decanters to the three-course meal
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Fashion, fine food and rhythm are not what Europeans tend to associate with Muslims or Islam today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are haunted by images of fundamentalists, not fun-loving eccentrics, and fanatics, not fans of refined culture
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As someone who is well aware of the destructive influence of violent Islamism in the Middle East
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I can, at a certain level, sympathise with fears in the West over radicalisation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But Islamic extremism is mostly a threat to Muslim societies, not to Europe
paragraphs.label: assumption
